entry.title: Russian Forces Advance in Southern Ukraine Ahead of Talks
entry.content: Russia deepened its military offensive in southern Ukraine, penetrating the city of Kherson, as the campaign stalled in the north of the country and the two sides prepared to resume cease-fire talks.

entry.title: For Average Russians, Western Sanctions Over Ukraine War Begin to Bite
entry.content: Soaring interest rates have pushed some Russians to hold off on buying homes. Others are stocking up on imported medications, and travel plans have been canceled.

entry.title: Ukrainian Jews, Under Putin's Bombs, Seethe at His Attempt to Smear Ukraine as Neo-Nazi
entry.content: To Ukrainian Jews and many Jewish leaders world-wide, Russian President Vladimir Putin’s false claims that Kyiv is controlled by American-sponsored neo-Nazis is an insult to the memory of the Holocaust, especially now that Moscow is indiscriminately shelling Ukrainian cities.

entry.title: How Might the War in Ukraine End? Five Factors Will Shape the Outcome
entry.content: Russian forces have performed poorly thus far, but Ukraine’s military is expected to eventually crack. What then?
